mission.title: Our purpose
mission.text:
Our goal, at inmemori, is to support each family who has suffered the tragedy of losing someone they love, to help them gather their family and friends in paying homage to their memory.

Everyday, condolence messages, incredible memories and transcendent testimonials are shared using inmemori. They remind us that sharing our experiences with one another, seeing our loved one through someone else's eyes is life-giving, in a moment of what seems like vast emptiness.

At inmemori, our goal is to provide every family that suffers this tragedy to have a place of comfort, of support and sharing. We have dedicated ourselves to providing a free service that families can use to begin that life-giving process of mourning, healing, celebrating. In one year, we've supported 30,000 people. With inmemori, we hope to reveal the essentials of life, celebrating the moments that mark us, those that make us human.

story.title: How we came about
text: Clémentine decides to support grieving families as they organize the funeral services. While simultaneously working as the CMO of a French publicly traded company, Clémentine spent a week, out of every month, for six months, with families who've suffered a loss to best understand how she could comfort them during this immeasurable period of pain.
Constance joins the team to speak with families everyday, to answer families' questions and help them make full use of inmemori's services.

Families and their loved ones, grateful for inmemori and its role in their healing, become its ambassadors. Simply through word of mouth, inmemori was able to support 30,000 people in their moment of loss.
inmemori is selected to participate in an acceleration program in Silicon Valley, The Refiners. inmemori's ambitions go global.
Offices in Paris and New York City are opened. The team has 5 people dedicated to fulfilling inmemori's purpose.
inmemori inspires some of the most well-known venture capital funds in France to accelerate its growth and better support families during their time of need.

values.title: Our values
values.text: Our purpose is to reveal the essentials of life. To create a collective consciousness through memory.
items: We are inherently conscious of the complexity of this period for families and the need for utmost delicacy. You are at the heart of inmemori's mission.
inmemori provides a safe space for people to share in, protecting words, photos and memories from uninvited eyes.
inmemori is for all ages, cultures and creeds. Loss and love touch us all, so should inmemori.

team.title: Who are we ?
team.text: Here's a team that unites beautiful, soulful energy and enthusiasm to create life out of loss, at the heart of inmemori.

items.name: Clémentine Piazza
items.bio: An HEC Paris graduate, Clémentine worked in asset management and was named CMO of Unibail-Rodamco before setting off on her entrepreneurial path, launching inmemori in 2016.
items.intro: This is a profound mission that puts everything in its rightful place.

items.name: Constance de Vernejoul
items.bio: A graduate of Reims business school, Constance worked in PR and international communications at L'Oréal. First to have joined inmemori, she's helped support 300 families and seeks to accompany countless more.
items.intro: I wanted to be there for others during a period in their lives when they felt profoundly alone.

items.name: Marly  Diallo
items.role: Head of Business Development & Operations, France
items.bio: Having finished her studies at ESSEC business school, Marly was a senior asset manager at Unibail-Rodamco, where she met inmemori's fearless leader, Clémentine. She then joined Walt Group as a project manager, then global luxury group Kering.
items.intro: The effort our team puts in everyday lets us contribute to creating strong, resilient communities.

items.name: Eva Kerner
items.bio: A UCSB, Sciences Po and LSE grad, Eva worked in PR and digital strategy before working with Fabernovel to develop a multinational insurance carrier's innovation lab in San Francisco. Eva heard Clémentine's pitch in SF and the rest is history.
items.intro: It's said that we die twice. Once when we take our last breath, and the second, when someone utters out name for the last time. With inmemori, I can help make sure people's names and memories thrive.

items.name: Louis Grellet
items.bio: Engineer and entrepreneur, Louis was Allopneus' CTO and CEO at Flooz.
items.intro: It's a moment in life where digital is absent. Therefore, it's a technical challenge that I'd like to solve.
